image.altText: a bearded man wearing a blue suit and sunglasses walks in front of the ACT Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A former sex worker stealthed by a customer tells the ACT Supreme Court despite the pain and suffering she hopes her attacker will find it "in his soul to become a better person".

title.children: Former Canberra sex worker tells of 'turmoil' after being stealthed

image.altText: Canberra Raiders NRL player Joe Tapine speaks to referee Adam Gee as rain falls during a game.

props.synopsis: Canberra coach Ricky Stuart warns against punishing aggression in rugby league as we head into the men's State of Origin series opener on Wednesday night.

title.children: Three Raiders charged as Ricky Stuart issues Origin warning

image.altText: 11 women standing behind a table with a cake on it with their hands up in celebration.

props.synopsis: What started out as three women called Shirley having a cuppa became an international club with thousands of members. But now the future of the club is bleak.

title.children: Shirley hated her name until she joined a same-name club

image.altText: A small tree with an orange banksia flower.

props.synopsis: Australian flora was once deemed too difficult to cultivate as bonsai but those misconceptions are fading with every native bud.Â

title.children: In recent years the banksia has become a surprise bonsai

image.altText: A teenage boy with short brown hair wearing glasses and headphones holding an iPad and a sensory soft toy stands smiling.

props.synopsis: For neurodivergent children, going to the emergency department can be overstimulating so the Canberra Hospital has introduced a sensory-friendly room in the children's emergency area to make the experience less overwhelming.

title.children: Max gets overwhelmed in hospital. A sensory-friendly room could help

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man identified by a crooked crowbar and a home CCTV system he installed is convicted of aggravated burglary for breaking into and robbing two cafes in one night.

title.children: Canberra burglar undone by own CCTV system and a crooked crowbar

image.altText: An unidentified child care worker holding hands with a child.

props.synopsis: Former childcare educators are revealing serious incidents at Affinity Education's Canberra centres, including a case of a baby rolling off a change table.

title.children: 'Toxic': Former Affinity childcare staff say baby fell off change table

image.altText: An old man looks around his flood-affected living room as a middle-aged man in a firefighter's t-shirt carries a door past.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of homes are uninhabitable after record NSW floods. This is what it looks like returning to a street where most homes were under water. Â

title.children: On this one street, half the residents lost entire homes to NSW floods

image.altText: Close up of a woman's hands typing at a computer keyboard with some jewellery on and a large fitness watch on her wrist

props.synopsis:
Productivity is dominating headlines, but is it really possible to measure in Australia?Â 

Â

title.children: The great productivity debate is totally unproductive

image.altText: A woman looks over a charred and burnt out car in a residential car park.

props.synopsis: The Kremlin says people are beginning to experience "emotional overload" after the US president lashed out at continuing strikes on Ukraine.

title.children: Trump realising Putin 'lies', Macron says, as Kyiv hit by record drone strikes

image.altText: PM in akubra hat smiling as he sits next to indigenous elder Pat Dodson.

props.synopsis: Former senator Pat Dodson says Anthony Albanese "was smart not to drink from the poisoned chalice" in stepping back from reconciliation efforts after the failed Voice referendum.

title.children: 'Poisoned chalice': Dodson gets why Albanese backed away from Indigenous issues

image.altText: A machete

props.synopsis: The government is struggling to define and stick to its political narrative, while grappling with a law-and-order problem.

title.children: As shoppers ran in horror, Victoria's premier went into survival mode

image.altText: A phone screen glows with a map of Launceston while mounted on a phone holder inside a car at dusk.

props.synopsis: A member of a prominent Melbourne family has been accused of being involved in unconscionable conduct in a bitter court battle involving a serial fraudster and a US lawsuit against Uber.

title.children: Melbourne businessman named in court battle involving rideshare giant Uber

image.altText: Two caucasian-looking women with black t-shirts with Aboriginal flags stand on stage, one in sunglasses reads a speech

props.synopsis: A north-east Tasmanian councillor says the Welcome to and Acknowledgement of Country being given at events the council is involved in should cease as they have "served their purpose" â a move that has been criticised by the local mayor and Aboriginal associations.

title.children: 'Served their purpose': Move to dump Acknowledgement of Country

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: An investigator looking into a deadly 2023 lunch told the court that details in Ms Patterson's account of events changed over the course of several conversations.

title.children: Health official says Erin Pattersonâs account of deadly lunch changed

image.altText: A man wearing a suit is shoved in the face by a woman wearing a red jacket who is blocked by a door

props.synopsis: An Elysee official says a video which captures France's first lady pushing the president as they exit a jet in Vietnam shows the couple "having a laugh".Â

title.children: Emmanuel Macron downplays face shove from wife Brigitte as 'joking'

image.altText: Dylan Edwards is tackled by Val Holmes

props.synopsis: Rugby league's fiercest rivalry will return to the field this week, with the men's State of Origin series kicking off in Brisbane. Here's what to know about the match.Â

title.children: State of Origin is around the corner. Here's what to know ahead of Game I

image.altText: A screenshot from a Queensland government advertisement video on youth crime.

props.synopsis: The government has confirmed to the ABC it plans to spend about $1.85 million on ads about youth crime.

title.children: Queensland LNP defends multi-million-dollar ad spend

image.altText: police in bali hold a press conference showing bags of cocaine and a man under arrest with orange jumpsuit and black balaclava

props.synopsis: Police in Bali say 43-year-old Lamar Aaron Ahchee was arrested at the scene after allegedly picking up a package containing $1.1 million worth of cocaine hidden in chocolate wrappers.

title.children: Australian could face death penalty for allegedly smuggling 1.8kg of cocaine in Bali

image.altText: Pets at Ovolo Hotels

props.synopsis: The cost of the accommodation for the chair, his wife and his "fur-baby Vito" at Brisbane's inner-city Ovolo hotel last year was queried by the company's CEO.

title.children: Company chair stayed in $500 a night pet hotel room for board meeting

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks to reporters wearing a 'Make America Great Again' cap

props.synopsis: The US president said on Truth Social that billions in previously awarded grants would instead go to trade schools.Â

title.children: Trump threatens Harvard with loss of $4.6b in grant funding

image.altText: Grandstand for horse racing track with trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A vote on the future of Rosehill Gardens Racecourse will mark the end of a 17-month saga involving racing identities, parliamentary inquiries, property deals and briefly, the corruption watchdog.

title.children: A key plan to 're-shape Sydney' could be dead after a vote today

image.altText: A man with a shaved head and a light beard wears a puffer jacket while sitting at a desk with a computer on it.

props.synopsis: Council Watch says it holds local governments to account. Some Victorian councillors say it is actually "ground zero" for misinformation and abuse.

title.children: Victorian councillors accuse pro-ratepayer group of 'vile' attacks

image.altText: Emergency lights and a "police" sign flashing at night.

props.synopsis: A 61-year-old man is under police guard in hospital after the car he was driving hit a tree, killing two passengers.Â

title.children: Police launch homicide investigation after two killed as car hits tree

image.altText: A woman sitting on a verandah and smiling.

props.synopsis: Sue Roman was one of hundreds of children taken from the notorious Darwin mission Retta Dixon and sent across the country to work as a servant.Â

title.children: Forced into slavery at 12, Sue Roman brought a royal commission to Darwin

image.altText: Brothers Bobby and Tony Buttsworth are farmers standing outdoors next to a dog and in front their rain soaked paddock

props.synopsis: These third-generation dairy farmers have 500 mouths to feed and nothing but a paddock of mud after the floods devastated their NSW Mid North Coast property.

title.children: Last week these farmers were milking. Now their cows are off to the abattoir

image.altText: a close up image of sandals with socks underneath at the beach

props.synopsis: Temperatures are set to plummet by mid-week for much of the state, forcing Queenslanders to pull out their winter woollies.

title.children: 'Melbourne-style' weather on the way for parts of Sunshine State

image.altText: Dust flies through the air at Jamestown

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers have welcomed this week's rain but many were left "heartbroken" by destructive winds that whipped up top soil after seeding.

title.children: SA farmers say 'wet winter' needed to break drought

image.altText: A car submerged in water next to a dock.

props.synopsis: A couple celebrating their 57th wedding anniversary have had to be rescued after their car drove off a dock and into the water as they attempted to board a ferry in Tasmania.

title.children: 'Quick thinking' ferry staff praised after rescuing couple from submerged car

image.altText: Hoor Al Qasimi, an Emirati woman in her mid-40s, wearing a velvet blue coat, poses outside, beside a transparent fence.

props.synopsis: The Biennale of Sydney, under new artistic director Hoor Al Qasimi, is called "Rememory" and features art from the likes of Packing Room Prize winner Abdul Abdullah.

title.children: How this biennale will reach out to people who don't think art is for them

image.altText: A man rests his head on his chin as he looks to his side in a dimly-lit room.

props.synopsis: A profound schism is emerging between Liberals who want the party to move to the "sensible centre" and those who believe moderates are hijacking the devastating election loss to suit their agenda.

title.children: 'We've put off arguments â¦ time to have it out': Liberals reveal deep divisions

image.altText: Parts of the Kempsey district are still under water following record flooding.

props.synopsis: Areas still recovering from last week's record floods are now bracing for gale-force winds, prompting concerns about falling trees.

title.children: 'Dangerous situation' as strong winds forecast for flood-stricken NSW

image.altText: View looking through soccer goal at Abbeville Park

props.synopsis: A 46-year-old man has been charged after he allegedly grabbed a young boy by the neck at a junior soccer match in Perth's north.

title.children: Man charged for allegedly choking 11-year-old at junior soccer game

image.altText: Rafael Nadal waves to fans at Roland Garros during a retirement ceremony.

props.synopsis: Fourteen-time French Open winner Rafael Nadal is honoured by the return of Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray in an emotional ceremony at Roland-Garros.

title.children: 'Couldn't let you leave like that': Big Four reunite to honour Nadal
